name: The Beverly Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had never been to Beverly Hills so we chose this hotel as we are Gold members of their rewards program. We had a one night stay as part of an overnight layover from Tahiti on November 20th. We were more than impressed with this stay and only wished that we could have stayed a couple more nights.
reviews.title: Well worth it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I first want to thank Yamileth for all of here help at check in. She was so awesome. We can not thank her enough. Employees like her are the reason that I am loyal to this brand of hotels.
reviews.title: Consistantly excellent
Great Service/Great Property!
reviews.text: The lobby of the hotel was pretty amazing. Very clean and bright. It is one of those hotel lobbies that you would actually want to hang out in.
The room was pretty impressive as well. The bathroom comes with a TV which I really like. The bed was very comfy.
reviews.title: Old World Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did order room service. It was fast and really good. The man that delivered the food was very friendly even with it being 3 a.m.
reviews.title: I loved the hotel and the location
Great Hotel
reviews.text: Nicely remodeled Hollywood theme hotel in convienent location near West LA, West Hollywood, and LA sites. BIG. Nice pool for summer visits. Junior Suite is well worth a bit extra.

If you book through Priceline expect to be dumped into the old Oasis wing. The rooms are old and show it. The bathroom is in particular are in need of a complete overhaul. My room was on the first floor and was dark and felt like a cellar. Everything at the hotel though is priced like it's a five star resort. $10 for a in room bottle of Jana water. $15 a day for internet access. Parking is $20/ Breakfast options begin at $15. The best thing about this hotel is the location but if you're looking for a bargain this is not it. If you want the 4-star luxury you need to book through someplace other than Priceline or Hotwire.
reviews.title: 3 star if you're on Priceline

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was nice but the room we got was average yey comfortable as we got it through priceline. We were staying in an oasis room in the back, not the tower one. Location is excellent to explore Beverly Hills and only a short ride to many places such as Rodeo drive and Sprinkles cupcake. There's a free limo but only if it's available. Most staffs are nice but housekeepers just tried to enter the room without knocking. Big screen TV, spacious room and nice shower but you have to ask for shower gel and slippers.
reviews.title: Nice stay but nothing special
AMAZING BUT PRICY
reviews.text: No free WIFI in a room but in a lobby. Lots of history in a hotel and seems had many events during our stay. Room service is a little pricey.

reviews.title: Great location, average room and overpriced!
reviews.text: Overall we had a nice stay but wouldn't pay for the full price. By the way, don't get a connected room as you could really hear other couple getting it on.
We stayed four nights and were so pleased with the hotel, restaurant and spa. The staff went out of their way to make us feel confortable. Didn't want to leave!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with wonderful staff

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights starting Christmas. The hotel was well decorated for the holidays and the front office staff were very pleasant. We got upgraded to the junior suite in the Wilshire tower - great views of the city. The room was not as big as we thought the junior suite would be but no complaints. The bathroom was very nice and clean - separate shower stall and tub.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: The location is great as we could walk to Rodeo drive and all of the restaurants. Starbucks is a block away. The concierge (Ana Rosa) was helpful and recommended an Italian restaurant (Il Fornaio) for dinner - the food was delicious and desserts were awesome.
reviews.title: A First Class Hotel and Professional Staff

reviews.text: We did the brunch at the hotel on Sunday and it was quite good although quite expensive. Lots of options in food including sushi and service was good.
reviews.title: Not very hhonors friendly, and an odd mix of good and bad

reviews.text: Outdoor pool area looked great - pity it was chilly so our children didn't go in. Parking is expensive $29 a day.
reviews.title: Disappointing if you don't upgrade to the newer rooms

reviews.text: I think I have had it with Hiltons and big name hotels. This place is simply a dated property resting on its laurels. I will stay in a boutique hotel next time for better service and nicer rooms. If you do stay please avoid the older rooms....pay for the Wilshire Towers. The older rooms are in awful condition, just terrible. Ours had a picture that had been stolen from the wall, popcorn on the floor, and some kind of odd cement block under the sink. I complained and after much waiting we were finally offered a room in the Tower. While that room was considerably better, there was still a nasty hole in the carpet in the middle of the room and the armchair and couch was just filthy. We had been in NYC the week before and couldn't believe what a contrast this place in Beverly Hills was with the 5 star boutique hotel we had stayed at in Manhattan. I find it so odd that celebrities stay here, it really is average. Bad breakfast with over priced, only acceptable food.
reviews.title: Nothing special. Worn and dated property.

reviews.text: Beware~there is a woman named Sharon in the back office that I spoke with. I asked her to please hold our room for a late check in. Sharon was rude and abrupt to the point of being insulting on the phone. Just dreadful customer service skills. Unfortunately our first introduction to the hotel was by speaking to Sharon, and it was a nasty experience. We are Gold Honors Members and she was probably the worst person we have had to deal with in the Hilton chain. The other staff was passable but in general not interested enough to interact with their guests. A shame. I usually consult a manager when I'm this unhappy but my children were with me and I just didn't feel like getting myself distressed any further on what was supposed to be a holiday. Of course, we won't be returning.
reviews.title: Poor in contrast to other hotels in the area

reviews.text: Things didnt start well when greeted by a frosty receptionist. 'You won't be getting any of your gold honors benefits here' is not the best way to start off a hotel experience. The rooms are very dated and the bathroom is more like that of a 3 star property. The shower lacked any real power and there was only a shampoo provided. Having just spent 2 nights at the Sofitel (and paid a similar room rate) I would have to say this hotel is seriously lacking and has a long way to go to catch up with the competition. I was given complimentary continental breakfast (which gold members are entitled to) but the service here does not compare favourably to that of other Hiltons or similarly priced competitors in the area
reviews.title: Bev. Hilton not what you'd expect!

reviews.text: Just returned last night after several days on business in LA. have stayed at every note worthy property in LA. B.H. is way overpriced, no extras (for 300.00 a night really?), no in-room coffee, rude security, front desk lady was worst ever. However, James in Conc., and Art at front desk were great! Actually had nude (man) drunk guest knocking on doors up and down the hall at 2:30am, I (and others) called security and all I got was a knock on the door at 6am asking if I had a medical issue. Talk about livid! Location is of course awesome. Hilton Corporate should not forget about business folks from other parts of the country, the property was not close to full. I am smart enough to know that they could care less about me and my exper. My advice.... stay somewhere else. bell staff and housekeeping were great! Finally, I was very unhappy there...and they could have not cared less!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We loved our stay at this hotel and if you like a little celebrity spotting then this is a hotel to stay at. We were lucky enough to be there when some awards were held there this week. Food was beautiful, cocktails also awesome.
reviews.title: Amazing Problem Resolution

reviews.text: On my last day at this hotel with family for 3 nights staying in juniour suite. On arrival by taxi no help from bell desk, they were to busy in a group batting having their morning mothers group meeting.
reviews.title: Just O.K

reviews.text: the women that checked us into the room was cold as ice, she needs a few lessons in customer service. To be honest the feeling you get when you walk around the hotel is pretty much the same from most of the employees in this hotel. It really seems that no one really wishes to be here, and you don't get any real warm feeling towards you from staff at all.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not a very big Breakfast variety to choose from, pool looked quite nice but we did not have the opportunity to use it. You wouldn't dare touching the mini bar because it will cost you a arm and a leg eg. water $10.50, Mai Tai Mix $11.00, Pistachios $10.00, Assorted Nuts $10.00 I'm sure you get the idea. Bathroom was nice, but no toothbrushes in sight , you need to call and ask for them, if they show up your one of the lucky ones, we kept on asking for 4 toothbrushes we always received two.
reviews.title: the beverly hilton

reviews.text: TV looked like it had been through the war zone, a very old plasma, room overal size was ok for a couple but not really to great for a family of four. when you turn the sofa into a bed and bring in a roller way bed it doesn't leave you to much room to move around in, especially when nature calls in the middle of the night. ( You can only have a very young child on the sofa bed as the mattress is very thin and anyone over 30 kilos would have springs going through the mattress into there back) Though the King size bed was quite comfy and I did have a good sleep through my stay here.
reviews.title: Understated elegance

reviews.text: house keeping did a nice job and walking into the room with dim lights and soft music playing was nice to walk into. Not that much to do for a family here, we walked up to rodeo drive which was a nice 15 minute walk, and visited Universal studios which is a $40 cab ride.
reviews.title: Gross, rude-service

reviews.text: The hotel was under some renovations/upgrades when I was there and we were put in a room that had not been renovated yet. The bed was terrible. It was very soggy and hurt my back. I woke up in the middle of the night to the sounds of running water, only to find the toilet was running over. I had to call maintenance in the middle of the night, but they handled it right away. The hotel itself is beautiful and if you get one of the room s on the renovated side, I would suggest this hotel. Trader Vic's is a nice place to eat. There are several nice shops inside the hotel and valet parking is reasonable.
reviews.title: Nice hotel / bad bed

reviews.text: I'll preface the hotel by saying that I come to this area in LA about 1-2x per year usually on a part business-leisure vacation and I have until this point stayed at the Hyatt Century City, which has just incredibly rude and impersonal service. So this time I tried the similarly priced Hyatt.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the service. Check-in was much smoother than the Hyatt. People seemed to appreciate my being there. Water pressure in the room was fantastic. The gym was adequate. The breakfast buffet was great and was included in my rate--it overlooks the pool. Valet parking was extremely efficient (the Hyatt had lost my keys twice over the years and usually takes 45 minutes to get your car). The pool, while not as ornate as the Hyatt's and lacking a hot tub, is still pretty awesome.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a great location

reviews.text: I would stay here again for sure if I were visiting this part of Los Angeles.
reviews.title: Not Pleased

reviews.text: Work trip and conference to the Beverly Hilton. The staff is outstanding the minute you get out of the car. They great you by name and welcome you to the hotel. (of course they read your luggage tag, but it is a nice touch). The room I had, King Single was very nice, comfortable, and quiet. The rooms are not huge, but still nice. I did see they are doing renovations right now, and totally redoing floors on one of the towers.
reviews.title: Lovely old school hotel

reviews.text: Good, it got the name. But one should really experience it.
reviews.title: fantastic stay

reviews.text: Friendly check in, nice rooms (had a junior suite, a bit pricey but ...), nice!!!! (and I mean it) food at the restaurant downstairs as well as absolute perfect service.
reviews.title: Rooms are very old

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is a bit noisy but ok.
reviews.title: An Experience! Very Cool!

reviews.text: All in all: a very solid recommendation
reviews.title: Good service and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was in Hilton for fove days it is less than my expectation .
reviews.title: The Beverly Hills Experience

reviews.text: I was very impressed by the Beverly Hilton. Check-in was very smooth and all hotel staff were very helpful. They tried to charge us $25 for the roll-away bed (which we did use) at check-out but it was refunded immediately because we were not told of the charge at check-in.
reviews.title: Loved the Beverly Hilton - most comfortable beds ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very nice and clean and the hotel was in a great location. Within walking distance from Rodeo Drive and right in the center of Beverly Hills. Around $40 in a taxi to Santa Monica Pier and West Hollywood.
reviews.title: Beverly Hilton is Superb. Great Service!!

likes.liked: — Quality of products in room. Room Layout. Service

reviews.text: I would certainly recommend staying here and would stay again. One thing which I was very thankful for was purchasing the breakfast vouchers when I booked the hotel. It was only an extra $30 per night and if you had not purchase these for three people, the breakfast would have cost $108!!!! They charge about $40 for service charges and gratuity. $30 well spent!!
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: The pool area was very nice with comfortable lounges and complimentary bottled water. The only way I did not rate a 5 rating was because of the complimentary shuttle service. The hotel takes you free of charge within 3 miles radius of the hotel but everytime we asked for it, it was busy. We should have tried to pre-book though and I would recommend doing this.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

likes.liked: — great location, easy to get to

reviews.text: I travel several hundred nights per year. For business, I usually stay at Hilton, Marriott, or Intercontinental in the USA and Internationaly. For leisure, we normally stay at Ritz Carlton, or similar level.
reviews.title: Disappointing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a few nights at the Beverly Hilton using Hilton points and then read the reviews on TA…We almost canceled the reservation after reading how bad some of them were, how expensive the parking was, etc. I am glad we didn’t. When we checked in we requested a “NEWER”room in the Wilshire Tower and were given room 264. It was fantastic. The only downside being the low floor who’s view was of the roof of level 1. The room itself was clean and big and I am assuming it was recently redecorated because there was nothing to complain about the décor. It was actually very “Four Season-ish” with a butter colored wallpaper and dark wood furniture.
reviews.title: MUCH MUCH BETTER THAN EXPECTED

reviews.text: The parking IS expensive, but I have to say the valet’s were awesome. Every time they brought our car arounnd they replenished it with water bottles. Service in the restaurants was great as well. Our Hilton Gold status was honored and we were given breakfast coupons for each morning we were there.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel stay June 2012

reviews.text: Often times we stay at Hilton’s and feel like we are in a souless corp property, but this time it reeally felt like a cool urban resort right in the heart of things. I highly recommend this property weather you are paying full boat or using points!
reviews.title: Beverly Hilton - June 2012
Nice hotel, standard rooms are 'standard'.
reviews.text: Trip to CA for wedding. daughter wanted to see beverly hills, so we stayed one night here. Hotel was fantasic. Valet was prompt and courseous, check in was exceptional friendly and quick, had a jr suite with the largest deck I have ever stayed on (it was about 30' by 10' and fit 4 no problem). the bathroom was modern and very clean. hotel is in great condition. One of the nicest hiltons I have stayed in. The pool was huge and there were a good number of families there. Pool side service was friendly and prompt and they had a few good deals on drinks (bucket of 5 16oz beers for $25). has a great history to it and the location cant be beat if you want to stroll through beverly hills, rodeo drive. Had the breakfast buffet in the morning which was also very good and they have some of the best coffee I have ever had. Wish we had stayed a few extra nights.
Myself and a gal pal had a 3 night “mini vacay” (sunning, shopping, eating).
reviews.title: Overpriced, even for Los Angeles

reviews.text: Recently returned from a holiday in the U.S. which included a few days stay in the Beverly Hilton.
reviews.title: Six out of Five
Best stay, near Hollywood
reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel which cannot be faulted, in particular the quality of the room and the friendly and efficient staff in reception.
I would give a special mention to the room service which is by far the best I have had in any Hilton hotel.
reviews.title: Very lavish
Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: Roll on next August.

I have stayed in many hotels in the area includin the Sofitel. This hotel is a perfect size and a great location. As in many places in L.A. make sure if you take cabs to try to get a local. This is the only city I have problems with cab drivers speaking english with serious attitude.
reviews.title: Definitely Five Star

reviews.text: This place was a great experience. The ambience and the food was really great. The location was at a such a convinient place.. it is just a walk away from rodeo drive where the shopping experience is great. It wsa good sleep and very enjoyable stay there.Would highly recommend it
reviews.title: Idle away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a three night stay. Only good thing about the place was location, beds and the waitress (Tabitha) in the lobby bar. Booked a tour through the hotel they came to pick us up swiped our card and left us behind...we are still trying to get the refund. Comment from the man behind the concierge desk very unprofessional. At the price you are paying a coffee machine should be in the room. We asked for one willing to pay for it but it was not followed through and no explanation why. Asked for a late checkout due to late flight told we could only have an hour longer after the checkout time of midday then found out from a guest you could pay for half a day longer this was not mentioned. Took 35 minutes to release our bags from the holding bay at the hotel. When questioned about this reply "I have rung the bell boy" finally bags came on a trolley and they watched us unload the bags ourselves then once unloaded said "would you like to put them back on and I'll push the trolley to your taxi?" Common sens to wheel the trolley to taxi in the first place. We had no time to change before the flight. $7.50 for a coffee and $34.00 for four beers!
reviews.title: Glad it was only three nights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't mind paying if the service goes hand in hand with the cost in this case it didn't. Could not wait to get out of the place fast enough.
reviews.title: Started 2013 in style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time at the Beverly Hilton and we could not be more impressed. I'm looking forward to planning my next 'staycation' at this great hotel. We checked in just after the New Year, Jan 2, to just chill out from the hectic holidays. From the greeting at the Front Desk to the politeness of the workmen in the hallways we knew we were in a high end hotel. The hotel is perfectly situated to walk to the shopping area of Beverly Hills or Century City.
reviews.title: So Sad...It Used to be Wonderful

reviews.text: The room had a great view and was quite spacious. We will definitely be back and have told all of our friends about what a great time we had. Cheers!
reviews.title: Our stay at the Beverley Hilton

reviews.text: Overall a lovely hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Elegant lobby, good location, excellent fitness room, and the restaurant has a good selection of options. I would have given excellent except for being able to hear the people 7 floors down in the open pool/bar/restaurant area at 2245 one night, and except for being able to hear my neighbors tv and wake up call through the closed adjoining doors of our rooms.
reviews.title: Beverly Hilton

reviews.text: I am frustrated when a hotel advertises and publishes images of refurbished rooms but only half the hotel is refurbished.
reviews.title: Advertises refurbished rooms that are not available

reviews.text: On arrival I was asked if I would like to carry my own bags. What?
reviews.title: A True Beverly Hills Icon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionist pointed out that my room was not refurbished, but for an additional $25 per night I could upgrade. What? Whatever happened to truth in advertising?
reviews.title: Our Anniversary

reviews.text: The upgraded room overlooked the car park, but when I protested, I was offered a better room. Reception explained that because I had booked the room through Priceline, I would only be given the minimum required. No refurbished room, even though there were plenty of refurbished rooms available, and not even a tea or coffee machine in the room, just the bare bones minimum.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights at the Beverly Hilton to chill out in a classic environment. We'd been traveling for a week and a half and thought the Hilton would be a break. It was a near-perfect visit. We had a great poolside suite, the staff couldn't be more welcoming, and my wife thought she was in heaven when the Hollywood Film Awards brought in tons of celebs for her "stargazing" fun. One glitch, though... The room next door was occupied by smokers. Not occasional smokers, mind you, but veritable chimneys. The smoke was in the hall, came through the (locked) adjoining door... You get the idea. So, we told the front desk; they said they'd contact the guests and ask them to stop. No go. The next day, we contacted the hotel manager, whose response was: "We're really sorry, but what would you like us to do?" Hmmm. How about enforce your own policy, which is no smoking in guest rooms, with a fine imposed upon those that do? In a final effort at humor, he did say: "If it makes you feel better, they're checking out tomorrow..." Uh, not funny. I'm hardly an anti-smoking person, but I don't necessarily want to breathe someone else's smoke -- nor do I want it on my clothes. Love the hotel, but the management could have done a better job on this one.
reviews.title: Terrific classic hotel, but watch out for smokers....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed a few nights here whilst in LA. Unadulterated luxury (at a price) which ranges from the reception to the rooms to the dining area to the pool.
reviews.title: 5* experience
Famous hotel that needs room updates.
reviews.text: The room was excellent - everything you would expect. I especially enjoyed the breakfast, with the room overlooking the pool which, by the way, had the most luxurious sunloungers I've ever seen.
Top stuff.
reviews.title: Non-celebrities are second class citizens here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room had two queen beds. The room should only have had one king size as the bathroom door was only inches away from bed. The room decor could use updating. We had some issues checking in as we had a reservation. This finally was resolved after much back and forth with front desk. Not a pleasant experience. Bathroom also could use updating. Make sure you have a copy of your reservation with the room rate on it. Never experienced this before as we have been at this hotel before.
reviews.title: An amazing experience

reviews.text: This is proberely one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in! We stayed at the beverly hilton for 3 nights on a stop off back home to the UK from NZ, and oh my god! We saw janet jackson and George Clooney walking into a event that the hotel had on! There was events each night we were there and paparazzi everywhere! Its was amazing!
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.text: We stayed in a standard room in the refurbished tower which has had about 10million spent on it! The room was great, a flat screen TV on the wall, a massive bed which was so big and comfortable! They treated us really well, considering they get alot of celebs staying there and Paris Hilton has a apartment at the hotel too!
reviews.title: Nice rooms close to the pool

reviews.text: We would recommend staying there although it is pricy as you never see celebs walking around, and the hollywood area is a bit roungh, but beverly hills is such a nice area, very safe to walk around at night with a starbucks down the road. The hotel is close to Rodeo Drive, but nothing else so a cab is needed, or you can use the hotels free LIMO, but tip requred anyway so its not Free!
reviews.title: Loved that largescreen plasma

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommended!
reviews.title: Most Comfortable Beds In The World

likes.liked: — The location, and the comfortable room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the BH Hilton twice after I travelled thru the South West of the US. The rooms in the "tower" are like the standard Hilton rooms, but you can get rooms directly connected to the pool. If you want to relax and if you do not care about strange coloured furniture it’s the better choice. The hotel is nice but some work has to be done in the floors and facade.
reviews.title: Okay but not a great location

reviews.text: Stayed at the Beverly Hilton for six nights; ABSOLUTELY loved it! Had a great room; great view. The room was large and comfortable, especially the beds; loved the plasma t.v. This hotel is also in an excellent location. Everyone was friendly and courteous; very helpful, if that is what you needed. Loved the bar/lounge in the lobby. That was our last stop every night before we went back to our room. This was also the place in the morning in which we received our complimentary coffee and muffin; a nice touch. Parking is expensive (but it seems like that throughout California). We self-parked, but always got a great spot on the first level; convenient. I also loved the fact that they change all the floral arrangements in the lobby area everyday; absolutely beautiful! This is a definite stop for us again in the near future. P.S. Also saw a couple of stars.
reviews.title: Didn't want to leave

likes.disliked: — Found a number of travelers requesting upgrades; hotel had no problem accomodating; courteous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Beverly Hilton hotel was the place to go when Hollywood was in its prime. The building exterior has not changed much since it was first built, but the interior has been remodeled to accommodate current trends. We enjoyed our room with plasma and a LCD displays. The king size bed was comfortable and the view of Wilshire blvd was a nice touch. The bathroom was medium size, but I would not call it the “luxurious bathroom” as described on their website. The room was quiet and clean. The Internet service was fast and reliable.
reviews.title: Beverly Hiltin matains a 4 star rating

likes.liked: — The updated room with Plasma displays

reviews.title: Great hotel!
reviews.text: The Hotel is centrally located in Beverly Hills which allowed us to take full advantage of their courtesy car. You can be driven to the Beverly Center, Rodeo Drive, UCLA (Westwood) or to Century City shopping center (WestFields shopping center) to name a few. Some staff members (Brian and Raymond) were friendly which made our stay comfortable. Overall the staff made our stay pleasant and the hotel accommodations did not make us think twice about returning to the Beverly Hilton.
Parking at the hotel is expensive not unlike any other hotel with a 4 star rating in Los Angeles. Guest also pay a larger than expected fee for valet parking so don’t forget to validate your ticket.
reviews.title: Great hotel, fantastic location.
Beverly Hilton was excellent
reviews.text: We booked an additional day and were not informed that we had to update our key card to regain access to our room. This was a minor inconvenience, but, I would still give this Hotel a 5 out of 5 rating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In town to celebrate my husband's birthday, we spent the night at the Beverly Hilton. Lobby was a little crazy as there was a producers awards show going on. Our corner room was very nice and we had a wraparound balcony. Bathroom was large and spacious. Parking is insane at $38/night.
reviews.title: Fancy Pants

reviews.text: We took a cab to dinner and our cab driver managed to hit a Mercedes as he went around the corner leaving the front of the hotel. It looked like the hotel valet not only parked the Mercedes in a red zone but on a corner. After the cab driver stopped to check out the damage, the hotel management swarmed the area. Not sure if I felt worse for the owner of the car or the cab driver.
reviews.title: Character and a Fifties feel but renovated.

reviews.text: The swimming Pool is this hotels best asset. We stayed in a room in the older Oasis wing then another night in the newly renovated Wilshire wing. The only difference was the bathroom was renovated but still using the same slow pressure shower heads. The restaurant food was very good and reasonable prices. If you get a chance stick your head into the Ballrooms especially the International. Beds very comfortable.
reviews.title: 2nd stay in main block this time, very nice room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my previous review was for a room in their "cheaper" tower which i think they use for Priceline guests... it was not a good experience. Arrived very late on a Friday, I'm thinking they'd filled that tower and we got a room in main building (despite booking through PL).... it was REALLY nice, spacious, huge luxury bathroom etc etc ... great bed, quiet a/c .. if i were wealthy and had paid full price, it would have been worth every penny.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: We just spent 3 nights at the Beverly Hilton as part of a vacation in the States to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary . We have travelled extensively and this hotel rates with the best. The service is outstanding and nothing is too much trouble. They recognised our anniversary with a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries and continually checked that we were enjoying our stay. Well done Beverly Hilton!! We will be back.
reviews.title: Love this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the staff at this hotel to be very helpful, and friendly, without having a "stuffy attitude" which is something i have found most 5 star hotel staff to have.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: The room was lovely, it wasnt massive, but gorgeous. The bed was very comfortable! The bathroom was fabulous .... very modern. The Hotel was spotlessly clean, and rather modern, but had traces of 50's/60's glamour throughout! 10 out of 10!
reviews.title: I could stay in those beds all day

reviews.text: Very chic hotel. I absolutely love the beds. Hotel looks like it had a lot going on, although I only stayed enough to enjoy the bed. If romance is what you're after.. a good nights rest here would certainly help.
reviews.title: The highest class hotel I have ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in The Beverly Hilton back in January 2007 for the iPOP! LA press/talent agent conference. I must say that this should be a five star hotel from my point of view. Everything was totally fit for us.
reviews.title: It's a Hilton, but with the comfyiest bed ever

reviews.text: When we checked in with our group, we were given a room on the 6th floor. The room number--639. The lobby had a really nice design on the walls that I just could not get my eyes off of. There was a fish tank with beautiful fish to look at while waiting for an elevator. Elevators were quick going up and down - faster than the average elevator (yaya!). The room was a King Bedroom with a balcony that had nice chairs. Very clean room! I looked for any dirt the first night and I found NOTHING! The room was spotless and the pillow covers were changed every 2 days [perfect]. My favorite part of the room were the 2 TVs. There was one 42" or something like that Zenith Plasma TV that had a relaxation channel with relaxing music and a colorful background/abstract that changed. But something that makes me want to go there again is the TV in the bathroom! Yes, there is a TV in the bathroom. I don't miss my favorite show while brushing teeth or taking a shower. The toilet was closed in a little toilet room and the shower - spotless. Housekeeping did a good job and arranged these two teddy bears that I brought in a holding-hands fashion :).
reviews.title: AMAZING! So much going on. I loved it!

reviews.text: Old HVAC, paint chipped, a 2 x 2 bathtub (a bath tubette), non opening windows, and staff that are unable to answer the question "Do you have overnight dry cleaning" all add up to say: stay at hotels at twice the price.
reviews.title: No way to hide it, an old beat up hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LA is huge! Beverly Hills is a city within a city which we discovered in the long cab ride from the cruise terminal to the Beverly Hills hotel.
reviews.title: Great location in Beverly Hills

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights in May 2012 after our Panama cruise. This hotel is well located and only a 15 min walk into the main Beverly Hills/Rodeo Drive shopping area, for anything else you will need to use a taxi or tour bus depending on what you want to see or do. This is usual for LA. The location is very quiet and peaceful.
reviews.title: Hotel of the Stars

reviews.text: We were able to arrange tours etc through the concierge and there was a complimentary hotel limo which could take you to nearby places and pick you up on call. The area is safe to walk around anyway.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay In Beverly Hills!

reviews.text: The room was very clean and the bed comfortable and was all you would expect in this class of hotel.
reviews.title: Second stay at the The Beverly Hilton, loved it again.

reviews.text: It was great being able to walk down to Rodeo Drive area, the Beverly Hilton is on the route for two of the hop-on hop-off bus routes so you can go from there to the Hollywood area or to Santa Monica. You need to allow lots of time as each route takes about 2 hours plus the time to actually sightsee.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel restaurant by the pool was great. I was there in winter, all tables had heaters, great food and very relaxed atmosphere.
reviews.title: An excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised at how much we loved the Beverley Hilton considering some of the Trip Advisor reviews are pretty harsh on the property. We had a truly wonderful stay and would return if given half the chance.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some of the gripes seemed to based around things like cost, however if you are familiar with Hiltons then you will know that all will charge for extras like Wifi, Parking etc. It does no harm to research these things before booking a high end hotel, removes the possibility of any nasty surprises. I'd imagine a prestige hotel such as this receives upgrade requests on a daily basis, so don't go expecting or simply book the room you desire. As a HHonors guest I am pleased to say that we definitely felt the love at the Beverley Hilton IYKWIM.
reviews.title: Well... it's like warm water.

reviews.text: Location wise, well you are a stroll from the upmarket Beverley Hills, like everything in LA you'll need a car to go exploring if you are here on vacation but as far as somewhere to base yourself you could do a lot worse than the Beverley Hilton. It's a great property that deserves it's place in Hollywood folklore and being able to sample a taste of that is what makes this property that little bit special.
reviews.title: A great hotel for a conference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 7 days it’s a good hotel but service has something to be desired. We stayed in a suite which was very modern and clean. The breakfast was not good so stopped having it after the second day. There is a starbucks less than five minutes away so go there. The pool was nice and in general a good area its 10 minutes walk from Rodeo drive. We had a car though as wanted to travel around $50 a day valet parking.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Will stay here again just because of the rooms and close proximity to restaurants etc. Beware of looking over the pool as music is very loud over the weekend had to be moved on more than one occasion.
reviews.title: Okay stay, nice hotel, great location, but obvious prostitutes

reviews.text: Not great and not bad..
reviews.title: Big name, small service
Somewhat Below Par
reviews.text: All in all a very nice hotel. Tons of history, nice room, okay food, nice bars, but prostitutes everywhere... Although not interested, I was propositioned on two different occasions... This was my only complaint. The restaurants were all acceptable, the bar was nice in both the lobby and Trader Vic's. HHonors diamond breakfast coupons covered continental breakfast at the main restaurant. It even included bagels and lox! My room was in the wilshire tower and although slightly small, it was very nice. Very comfortable bed, good workspace, nice balcony with a view of century city. The bathroom was very, very nice. The shower was great with wonderful bath products. There was even a very nice bathrobe. I would stay here again...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Though in a location where you are bound to see stars, the big screen TV in the room did not work and took several calls to the Front Desk to get a technician sent over. The Oscar nominee luncheon was held the day I checked out, and I had to move from the lobby and wait on the other side of the hotel, since I was in the way, competing for space with groupies hungering for photos. Otherwise, the service staff and front desk groups were helpful.
reviews.title: Charme of the good old times

aka: The Beverly Hilton Hotel Beverly Hills
description: With expansive views and inviting living spaces, the Beverly Hilton's inspired guest rooms express the best of relaxed, California living. Choose a spacious Wilshire Tower room, a poolside Cabana room, or a secluded Oasis room.
